guide.introduction: Solar lights are great applications for a remote application, like your back yard. You can make your own more powerful solar lights using LEDs. You can get the gear you need to build the solar lighting kit at FutureElectronics.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Solar lights are great applications for a remote application, like your back yard. You can make your own more powerful solar lights using LEDs. You can get the gear you need to build the solar lighting kit at FutureElectronics.

Relevant parts
  • Solar panel
  • Solar Charge Controller
  • Direct-burial wire
  • LED Light
  • LED Controller
  • Various Connectors
Tools
  • Screwdriver
  • Wire stripper/crimper

lines.text: Make your wiring connections from the solar lighting system.  They don’t come with the right connection to your charge controller.  First strip the wires about half an inch.
lines.text_raw: Make your wiring connections from the solar lighting system.  They don’t come with the right connection to your charge controller.  First strip the wires about half an inch.

lines.text: Then use the crimping tool to make a nice contact.
lines.text_raw: Then use the crimping tool to make a nice contact.

lines.text: Then insert the contact into the connector to make your first “whip.”  Repeat with the second wire.
lines.text_raw: Then insert the contact into the connector to make your first “whip.”  Repeat with the second wire.

lines.text: Connect the solar cells to the charge controller with your new connectors.
lines.text_raw: Connect the solar cells to the charge controller with your new connectors.

lines.text: Connect to the charging regulator with your screwdriver.
lines.text_raw: Connect to the charging regulator with your screwdriver.

lines.text: And the LED controller to the LED.
lines.text_raw: And the LED controller to the LED.

lines.text: The 22-watt LED we used was pretty bright.
lines.text_raw: The 22-watt LED we used was pretty bright.
